page.title: 07BEEKEEPING
page.content: We asked Mr.D.L.Jones a few questions about beekeeping as he is a beekeeper himself.He told us the following:-He has 10 hives. There are 50,000 bees in every hive. In the winter there is not much to do.He feeds them with sugar and water.He also told us that he'd been doing it for 10 years. He has a sort of uniform that he wears.It consists of a pair of wellingtons, an overall, a pair of gloves, and a black veil.Mr.Jones uses a smoker to get them in a good mood.This is how.He puffs smoke into the hives.The bees think there is a fire and fill themselves with honey.When they are filled with honey and in a good mood they are less likely to sting.They collect nectar and pollen from the flowers.They like clover very much.He takes them up to Moel Fammau for heather.
